name: Coral Rock Hotel

reviews.title: Most relaxed holiday ever!
reviews.text: Having read through all of the reviews, both good and bad, I am happy to report that I had a fantastic 7-night stay at Coral Rock and can safely be added to the much longer list of "good reviews". The bad seem to mostly be in the past, and the good seem to be getting better.

reviews.title: Questionable
reviews.text: It seems that Neil and Gill (the owner/managers) have been very busy upgrading and resolving many of the previous issues which plagued Coral Rock in the past. Our room was neat, the aircon worked perfectly, and the bathroom was clean. The restaurant/bar had a fantastic vibe with a great chill area upstairs with tv/dvd for the couch potatos. The quality and variety of food was excellent, and the pool overlooking the beach magnificent. The various snorkelling, rafting and diving-with-dolphins outings we had were incredible and the spice tour and tour of stone town were extremely interesting.

reviews.title: Absolutely magic
reviews.text: When reviewing this hotel, one has to take into account that Zanzibar is a small island with weak infrastructure, and shouldn't be directly compared to a hotel in a first world country. Despite this fact, the staff were incredibly friendly all around and made every effort to resolve any small issues we may have had immediately.

reviews.title: Two star rating sums it all up.
reviews.text: Please do not book here expecting a luxury 5-star resort serving french cuisine and room service (although the staff are very accomodating), as this will frustrate both you and the management. Coral Rock is ideal if you are looking for an authentic experience of Zanzibar. It is situated near a local village, and the locals are "part of the decor" so to speak.

reviews.title: What a cool place for kids
reviews.text: In conclusion, while every hotel will have areas that can be improved upon, I saw what Neil and Gill have accomplished in just a short time and I'm sure that every day that goes by will see this place improving its value and offering to its customers. Coral Rock is excellent value for money, and ultimately it is for people who want an extremely relaxed holiday doing very little but reading by the pool, snorkelling/sailing in the ocean, and drinking cocktails. If you go there with the right expectations you'll find that Coral Rock far exceeds its "2 star" rating. I give this hotel an 'Excellent' rating because it exceeds expectations in every aspect. I would definitely go there again and recommend it to my friends!

reviews.title: The most relaxing view imaginable
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 8 nighs of our honeymoon trip to Zanzibar last year and will never ever forget the view as long as live. We lost hours staring out at the expanse of beach and perfect turquoise water - it could not have been any more relaxing after a hectic wedding! The full moons were spectacular and the sunrises serene and calming and totally worth being up at 4.30am for....

reviews.title: Lovely location and helpful staff
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful but never too instrusive and managed to service every need however unusual... The service was in African time but so were we after 10 minutes of arriving! It was great that they came round during the afternoon while you were sunbathing and took food orders so when we went for dinner we were always served very quickly... The food was very tasty but after 8 days I will admit the choice became a bit limited and sometimes they did not have everything on the menu but I can forgive and forget seeing as they were so remote! The atmosphere and music in the bar was exactly what I expected of an African beach hotel - laid back, chilled and happy.

reviews.title: it is a dump
reviews.text: The infinity pool was small and a bit murky once you were in there but with the sea right below, it was no issue! We did several tours and the best by far was snorkling with a local guide called Mr Chicken (he will happily explain why he is so called!) - he took us out on a peaceful dhow boat and was very attentive in pointing out the occasional nasties like bluebottle jellyfish (they are only there at certain times of the day i.e with the tide - don't be put off) which was great as I've never been an overly confident swimmer in the sea... we reached a very calm chest height rock pool called the 'fish tank' which was 1 hour of snorkling bliss. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Great location and staff. Huge potential but pity about the management.
reviews.text: Finally the rooms, bit of a disappointment but I believe the suite was booked up so we just had a standard double. Basic but did the job and quite honestly, there was no reason to spend time in there apart from sleeping!

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: As long as anyone who books this hotel accepts that it is Africa and not pure luxury then you cannot fail to enjoy. I would definitley recommend this to anyone wanting value for money and a GREAT remote relaxing location.
Every African country has something magical and Zanzibar is no different.
reviews.title: Best trip in ages

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had no idea the East coast of Africa was so beautiful. That white sand, light blue sea, palm tree postcard IS Zanzibar. Direct flights from Joburg (with 1time) helps too! Coral Rock hotel is really, really cool with a truly beautiful beach where the sea colour changes more blues than a chameleon - the sea is warm, clear, full of life and the tidal changes magically transform the place every day. You'll enjoy lots of swimming, snorkeling, walking, adventures, good food. Accommodation is basic but the staff are great, run by a South Africa couple, friendly and helpful - I had the best holiday I can remember - can't wait to go back...
reviews.title: Best place on the east coast...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 6 days in January at Coral Rock and had a nice time. The location was beautiful. The bungalow was comfortable although the AC wasn't working due to the power cuts on the island. There were two fans working whole nights and there were only a couple of day times we didn't have electricity or water. The state of conditions was better than in many other hotels in the east coast (Nungwi and Paje) thanks to running 24 hours generators. Moreover, there were no mosquitoes. The restaurant is, we think, one of the best in the area. It works although they don’t have power all time. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at Coral Rock and when we get back (a fourth time) to Zanzibar we will definitely book at Coral Rock.
reviews.title: Relaxing in paradise

reviews.text: Extraordinary levels of service and care provided by the owners and their staff throughout our stay. So much so that we left the island and returned 3 days later for another 2 nights. Tasty fish and decent wines from the restaurant. You can linger all day in the pool, staring over shallow waters, dhow boats and seaweed farmers. Rooms are ideal -uncluttered, clean, comfortable - and all with their own seating outside so more staring out to sea can be achieved without even having to flop into the pool. Heavenly.
reviews.title: Coral Rock Hotel, the most badly managed hotel I have ever stayed in.

reviews.text: The location was beautiful. The waiters and bar staff were excellent. This hotel fell down on its bad management. Anyone was allowed to wander in, (there was no security or closed gates to the compound). Hence the camera and video of the family wedding which had just taken place at the hotel was stolen from a room where a young female guest was sleeping!!
reviews.title: Wonderfully located hotel, great food, lovely people, shame they've not quite sorted out the restaurant logistics yet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positive: The hosts, Daniel and Gillian, are trying to accomplish a lot. They have a well run restaurant in terms of food quality and value (and great wine menu) and do seem to try to run the place well. I was quite content on the whole with these aspects.
reviews.title: great restaurant friendly host but poor value for the rooms - eat at restaurant but save your dinero & stay elsewhere!

reviews.text: Negative: AVOID like the plague rooms N1 and N2 and the rooms near the generator.
reviews.title: Exceeded our Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My complaint is simply that the rooms N1 and N2 are sub-par compared to the other rooms yet the price is the same. No constant electricity means no A/C - fine. But unless you leave the door open to the bathroom (also no water at times), you have no draft. So you have the choice, either the room is incredibly hot or you can have some draft but smell the bathroom . (Note the island has electricity shortages and water shortages because no electricity means no pump - this is not the fault of the management but simply the vicissitudes of travelling to Zanzibar (upside is the view). The room i paid for was 120$ - i have gotten better rooms in downtown Tokyo for less than $80 over the x-mas season. Owners should not charge the same for N1 and N2 because these rooms do not have full ventilation. \
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.text: Also no cups or glasses in the bathroom and the room was not properly cleaned (still some remnants of the past visitor)
reviews.title: What a great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we had been given better rooms (too bad we are not buddies or family from South Africa) or charged less because of the subpar rooms, the experience would have been very positive but we never got a full night sleep while we were there. There is a lot of positive in this hotel complex, but the rooms are far from equal to one another.
reviews.title: What an experience!!!!!!!!!

description: Coral Rock is one of the most popular small to mid-size hotels in Zanzibar. We offer incredible views and an authentic Zanzibari experience encourages local and cultural interaction within a functioning Swahili fishing village. Our aim is authenticity & value for money. We have arguably the biggest menu in Zanzibar.
